Lab-Grown Foods: Lab-grown foods, also known as cultured or in vitro foods, can be used as a source of essential vitamins and minerals. These foods are grown in a controlled environment, such as a laboratory, and can be designed to contain specific nutrients.

Nutrient-Dense Foods: Nutrient-dense foods, such as whole grains, lean meats, and dairy products, can be consumed to provide essential vitamins and minerals. These foods are rich in nutrients and can help to fill the gap left by the absence of fruits and vegetables.

Fortified Foods: Fortified foods, such as cereals and beverages, can be used to provide essential vitamins and minerals. These foods have additional nutrients added to them, such as vitamins and minerals, to help meet daily nutritional needs.

Nutrient-Infused Beverages: Nutrient-infused beverages, such as smoothies and juices, can be consumed to provide essential vitamins and minerals. These beverages can be made using a variety of ingredients, such as fruits, vegetables, and supplements, to ensure that they contain the necessary nutrients.

Nutrient-Rich Meals: Nutrient-rich meals, such as salads and stir-fries, can be consumed to provide essential vitamins and minerals. These meals can be made using a variety of ingredients, such as leafy greens, lean proteins, and healthy fats, to ensure that they contain the necessary nutrients.
